label: and
info: Logical AND.

label: break
info: Exits a loop.

label: do
info: Begins a block of code (used in loops and conditionals).

label: else
info: Specifies an alternative condition for an if statement.

label: elseif
info: Adds additional conditions to an if statement.

label: end
info: Marks the end of a block (e.g., for loops, functions, and conditionals).

label: false
info: Represents the boolean value false.

label: for
info: Defines a for loop.

label: function
info: Defines a function.

label: goto
info: Transfers control to a labeled statement (not commonly used).

label: if
info: Starts an if statement for conditional execution.

label: in
info: Used in a for loop to iterate over ranges or tables.

label: local
info: Declares a local variable (variable scope limited to the block).

label: nil
info: Represents the absence of a value or a null value.

label: not
info: Logical NOT.

label: or
info: Logical OR.

label: repeat
info: Starts a repeat-until loop.

label: return
info: Exits from a function and optionally returns values.

label: then
info: Specifies the code block to execute if a condition is true (used in if statements).

label: true
info: Represents the boolean value true.

label: until
info: Marks the end condition of a repeat loop.

label: while
info: Starts a while loop.
